citation.article-title: Snuella lapsa gen. nov., sp. nov., isolated from tidal flat sediment
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Snuella lapsa sp. nov.
Snuella lapsa [lap′sa. L. fem. part. adj. lapsa (from L. v. labor to glide) gliding].
In addition to properties given in the genus description, grows under aerobic and microaerobic conditions, but not under anaerobic conditions.
Cells are rod-shaped with rounded ends and approximately 0.6–0.7×1.5–2.7 µm.
Colonies are yellow-coloured, convex, translucent, glistening and circular with entire margins.
Gliding is observed on agar plates.
Does not grow on cetrimide or MacConkey agar.
Growth occurs at pH 6–9 (optimum, pH 7) and 10–40 °C (optimum, 30 °C).
Requires a sea salts concentration of 1–7 % (optimum, 3–4 %) for growth and cannot grow on sea-salts-free ZoBell medium supplemented with NaCl only.
Reduces nitrate to nitrogen.
Does not produce acetoin, indole or H2S.
Does not utilize citrate.
Acid is not produced from glucose.
Decomposes aesculin, starch, Tweens 20, 40, 60 and 80, and l-tyrosine, but not agar, adenine, alginic acid, casein, cellulose, chitin, egg yolk, elastin, gelatin, pectin, hypoxanthine or xanthine.

Positive for alkaline phosphatase, leucine arylamidase, valine arylamidase, acid phosphatase, naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase, β-galactosidase and N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase, and weakly positive for trypsin and α-glucosidase.

Negative for urease, arginine dihydrolase, lysine decarboxylase, ornithine decarboxylase, tryptophan deaminase, esterase (C4), esterase lipase (C8), lipase (C14), cystine arylamidase, α-chymotrypsin, α-galactosidase, β-glucuronidase, β-glucosidase, α-mannosidase and α-fucosidase.
β-Galactosidase activity is positive in API ZYM and API 20NE kits, but negative in the API 20E kit.

In the API 50CH system, produces acid from d-arabinose, d-xylose, d-galactose, d-glucose, d-fructose, d-mannose, methyl α-d-mannopyranoside, methyl α-d-glucopyranoside, N-acetylglucosamine, amygdalin, arbutin, aesculin ferric citrate, salicin, cellobiose, maltose, lactose (bovine origin), melibiose, sucrose, trehalose, raffinose, starch and gentiobiose; acid is produced weakly from methyl β-d-xylopyranoside, glycogen and turanose; and no acid is produced from glycerol, erythritol, l-arabinose, d-ribose, l-xylose, d-adonitol, l-sorbose, l-rhamnose, dulcitol, inositol, d-mannitol, d-sorbitol, inulin, melezitose, xylitol, d-lyxose, d-tagatose, d-fucose, l-fucose, d-arabitol, l-arabitol, potassium gluconate, potassium 2-ketogluconate or potassium 5-ketogluconate.

The fatty acids are composed of iso-C15 : 0, iso-C15 : 1 G, iso-C17 : 0 3-OH, iso-C15 : 0 3-OH, summed feature 3 (comprising C16 : 1ω6c and/or C16 : 1ω7c), iso-C16 : 0 3-OH, anteiso-C15 : 0, summed feature 9 (comprising C16 : 0 10-methyl and/or iso-C17 : 1ω9c), C15 : 1ω6c, anteiso-C15 : 1, C16 : 0, C17 : 1ω6c, C15 : 0 2-OH, iso-C13 : 0, iso-C14 : 0 and C16 : 0 3-OH.
The type strain is JC2132T ( = KACC 14152T = JCM 17111T), isolated from a tidal flat sediment sample from Ganghwa Island, Korea.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 35 mol%.
